subject: Art & Design
title: The Talkies: Cinema Gets a Voice
description: A 60-second lesson on The Talkies: Cinema Gets a Voice.

hook.text: 'Wait a minute, you ain't heard nothin' yet!' Al Jolson's line in 1927 ended the silent era forever.

buildup.text: The Jazz Singer was the first feature with synchronized dialogue. Audiences were electrified.

discovery.text: Sound added realism but killed careers. Many silent stars had voices that didn't match their image.

twist.text: Early sound cameras were trapped in soundproof booths. Films became static and stage-like for years.

climax.text: Engineers freed the camera with boom microphones and post-dubbing. Cinema became dynamic again by the 1930s.

punchline.text: Sound didn't just add dialogue. It reinvented the entire art form.

quiz.question: What was the first feature film with synchronized dialogue?
